doc.previous: Scientists who performed research in Oxford include chemist Dorothy Hodgkin who received her Nobel Prize for determinations by X ray techniques of the structures of important biochemical substances 120 Both Richard Dawkins 121 and Frederick Soddy 122 studied at the university and returned for research purposes Robert Hooke 14 Edwin Hubble 14 and Stephen Hawking 14 all studied in Oxford
doc.after: Robert Boyle a founder of modern chemistry never formally studied or held a post within the university but resided within the city to be part of the scientific community and was awarded an honorary degree 123 Notable scientists who spent brief periods at Oxford include Albert Einstein 124 developer of general theory of relativity and the concept of photons and Erwin Schr dinger who formulated the Schr dinger equation and the Schr dinger s cat thought experiment
